programme.title: Meet The Penguins
programme.desc: The Centres grumpiest resident, Crabby, greets a new arrival that melts his icy heart, and Princess - queen of the resident penguins - faces the biggest loss of her young life.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: Donna Stepan runs Sleepy Burrow Wombat Sanctuary. When she takes in a new orphaned baby in critical condition, the next 24 hours become a fight for its life.

programme.title: Pet Nation Renovation
programme.desc: Host Dave Salmoni follows Project Pawsitives renovation and transformation Bandits Adoption and Rescue of K-9s, a volunteer-run Virginian animal shelter.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: A medical emergency on the Wolfpacks ranch forces them to be more resourceful. And, Gabes family are concerned when he makes a hasty leap towards marriage.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: As the first snow falls, the Browns make a risky attempt to move their shelters closer to the barn. Noah prepares his pregnant wife Rhain for her first bush winter.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Experts test to see if wild wolves are smarter than domestic dogs with an interesting experiment. Plus, can spiders really fly? And, how do polar bears keep warm?

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Experts look at why drowned ants dont drown. Plus, why dont woodpeckers get headaches? And, how does a 15-foot octopus escape through a three-inch hole?

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: A dramatic rescue to save a manatees flipper uncovers a secret. Meanwhile, Investigator Casadevall is hunting for poachers whove left several cattle dead.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators are determined to get justice for a neglected dog and her puppy. Plus, Investigator Casadevall rushes to help some dogs suffering in the Miami heat.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emotional case lies in store for Houston SPCAs animal cruelty investigators when they find a puppy that has been badly beaten and has 13 broken bones.

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Its just days until graduation and the students finish their final rotations but although the countdown has started emergencies still need immediate attention.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: In Mozambique, the team track down the deadly devils flower mantis. Virtually invisible, it resembles a tropical flower and is covered in daggers and hooks.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: Bradley and Billy discover that the Yucatan thorn forest is the ideal home for the tough spiny-tailed iguana, but a perilous place for thin-skinned humans.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: When a puppy is found abandoned with a broken leg, Dr. Jeff is his only hope to walk again. Then, the team cares for a familys terrier who shows signs of a serious illness, and Dr. Baier and Hector head out to treat rescued pigs.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A young mans pet goat is injured in a freak accident. Can Dr Jeff help? Gus, a dog, has swallowed a mysterious object and has been unwell since.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Steve Irwins son Robert follows in his footsteps. After months of training, its time for him to solo feed the most notorious croc at the Australia Zoo.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Hunter the tiger is being sedated for his annual eye check, allowing Terri to get close. Bindi puts on a birthday party for Minibus - the Zoos oldest Wombat.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Fisherman and adventurer, Jeremy Wade, is with a commercial fishing boat in Alaska, searching for giant halibut. Will they catch the sought-after 50-lb halibut?

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Lizzy tries to track down the owner of a dog tied up outside the rescue centre. Plus, an older couple come looking for their first dog.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson helps a veteran with PTSD whose therapy cat is stressing him out. Plus, Bartholomew is not only tearing up the furniture but also a marriage.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio and his team look back on some of their biggest and best builds. And, grateful owners give an update on how much the animals are enjoying their new cribs.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: ATM is excited to design a tank for WWE superstar Titus ONeil. The guys will need to work as a team to deliver a Gator tank with a University of Florida theme.

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest delves into the island of Java in Indonesia, seeking the Javan tiger. It was declared extinct in 2003, but there have been recent reported sightings.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett make a tank for world famous artist and DJ Redfoo of the band LMFAO. The guys attempt their very first one of a kind DJ booth aquarium. Will this tank be able to get the party started?

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A company designing customisations for high-end and rare vehicles wants an exotic fish tank. They want a huge, three-sided build as their centrepiece.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: NASCAR driver Kurt Busch and his wife want a little piece of paradise inside their aquarium. They want to replicate their wedding location!

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: The volunteers encounter a blizzard, freezing rivers and sub-zero temperatures. They feel like they are losing it, but at this point there is no turning back.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: When puppy Murphy eats a piece of his basket, an operation to remove the piece reveals an abnormal blood vessel. Surgeon Kathryn is shocked at its size; can she cure him?

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Zoo staff face unexpected setbacks weaning a bright sea lion pup off her mothers milk. And, the bird team steps in to support a rejected curassow chick.

programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: The Alaskans are desperate to fill their smokehouses before winter. The Seldens help haul home Tylers moose kill. Heimo and Charlie worry about a lack of meat.

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest delves into the island of Java in Indonesia, seeking the Javan tiger. It was declared extinct in 2003, but there have been recent reported sightings.

programme.title: Bad Dog
programme.desc: A dog digs ditches in its backyard and his owners use a bulldozer to fill them in. Plus, goats run amok at a birthday party and a dog steals underwear from its owner.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: With winter closing in, the Wolfpack races to build their homes before the ground begins to freeze. Later, a snowstorm threatens progress as they haul Bears new house--a shipping container--up to the highest peak on the mountain.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns raise the defences when they find grisly evidence that a new predator is stalking the ranch. And, Gabe builds an apartment for him and Raquell.

programme.title: Fish Or Die
programme.desc: The Barramundi is nearly impossible to find in the wild. The crew travels to Australia, where Aboriginal guides take them to a Barra fishermans paradise.

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: Zoo director Jim Breheny is excited to meet a king penguin chick. Keepers move a dangerous king cobra to a bigger exhibit, and the kiwis begin mating.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Max, a beloved camel, develops a large abscess on his head. Plus, an adorable marmot prepares for her first classroom visit as an ambassador animal.

programme.desc: When a puppy is found abandoned with a broken leg, Dr. Jeff is his only hope to walk again. Then, the team cares for a familys terrier who shows signs of a serious illness, and Dr. Baier and Hector head out to treat rescued pigs.

programme.title: Vet Life: Bonus Tails
programme.desc: A beloved basset hound has a condition that could complicate surgery for Dr. Ross. Plus, Dr. Lavigne doesnt want a vet tech to assist in an operation on her own dog.

programme.title: Vet Life: Bonus Tails
programme.desc: Yuki the bulldog ate something she shouldnt have, now Dr. Blue needs to find it. And, the rescue cat Dr. Lavigne adopted needs care after its double amputation.

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: A search and rescue is deployed to find a missing angler. Agents confront a repeat offender for harassing hunters and a felon is caught with an illegal firearm.

programme.desc: The Barramundi is nearly impossible to find in the wild. The crew travels to Australia, where Aboriginal guides take them to a Barra fishermans paradise.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete goes behind the scenes with unseen footage, bloopers and lots of extra treehouse tours - including a peek inside Dale Earnhardt Jrs arboreal escape.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Two strays lead Lizzy and Villalobos staff on a wild goose chase. A grandmother comes in looking for another canine companion, but her dog Daisy has other plans.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson needs to find a way to help a distressed cat named Dale, whose uncontrollable peeing is driving a wedge between his guardians. It proves nearly impossible for Jackson to get a guilt-stricken guardian to stop feeding her diabetic cat Lasagna.

programme.desc: Get a fascinating insight into the private world of domestic cats in Animal Planets new cats eye view docu-soap series, and follow the felines through their daily lives.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Police rescue a turtle caught on fishing line and its up to Dr Ross to unhook him. Dr Blue awaits test results after performing dental surgery on a dachshund.

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: After Russell records thermal imagery that believes is Bigfoot. Mireya and Ronny have a terrifying experience when they realise theyre not alone in the forest.

programme.title: Panique au village : les grandes vacances
programme.desc: Indien et Cowboy s’ennuient ferme. Et s’ils construisaient un bateau de pirates pour aller naviguer sur le lac ? Le dernier-ne des courts metrages de la saga "Panique au village", des Belges Stephane Aubier et Vincent Patar. Un regal.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: La musique peut nous rendre euphoriques ou melancoliques. Meme les nourrissons se mettent à fretiller au rythme d’une comptine. Alors, quels mecanismes sont à l’œuvre quand nous eprouvons l’envie irrepressible de nous tremousser ? Longtemps cantonnee à la philosophie, cette question est desormais etudiee par les scientifiques, qui observent les neurones des musiciens et melomanes par imagerie cerebrale.

programme.title: Les artisans du bon pain
programme.desc: Après des etudes de philosophie, de pedagogie et de menuiserie, Jean-Jacques devient chauffeur de bus en Georgie. Ce Français originaire de Bretagne tombe amoureux du pays et de son pain. Il s’interesse au ble et aux techniques de confection, puis ouvre sa propre boulangerie à Tbilissi, la capitale.

programme.title: Les artisans du bon pain
programme.desc: Voilà vingt-cinq ans, Nicolas quitte Paris pour un village de Bretagne où il decide de fabriquer du pain. Le ble provient de sa propre ferme, autour de laquelle s’etendent des champs où cohabitent cereales, pois et haricots. Le boulanger travaille avec du gros sel et de la fleur de sel de Bourgneuf-sur-Retz que lui envoie un ami.

programme.title: Les artisans du bon pain
programme.desc: Après avoir parcouru l’Autriche, l’Italie et l’Allemagne, Arnd retrouve sa region natale, la Franconie, où il reprend les renes de la boulangerie familiale, ouverte depuis plus de trois siècles. Progressivement, il se tourne vers des produits locaux et biologiques et se passionne pour le levain naturel. Arnd mise aujourd’hui sur une clientèle de proximite pour faire vivre son commerce.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Aujourdhui, le feu est devenu synonyme de destruction, avec des incendies de plus en plus ravageurs emettant denormes quantites de CO2. De quoi accelerer le derèglement climatique qui, à son tour, favorise les departs de feu. Un cercle vicieux qui a pousse les chercheurs à qualifier notre epoque de "pyrocène".

programme.title: Les energies de la mer, toujours en lice ?
programme.desc: Parviendrons-nous un jour à produire de l’electricite à grande echelle en utilisant la puissance des oceans ? Un etat des lieux des echecs et des percees novatrices en la matière.

programme.title: Les vagues scelerates, un mystère de taille
programme.desc: En haute mer, enquete sur les vagues scelerates. Cauchemar de tous les marins, elles peuvent atteindre la taille dun immeuble de dix etages, soit près de 35 mètres de haut. Veritables murs deau surgissant de nulle part, elles menacent meme les bateaux les plus modernes.

programme.title: ARTE Junior, le mag
programme.desc: Notre dossier ecole de la semaine sinteresse à legalite entre les filles et les garçons. Les traite-t-on de la meme manière, partout dans le monde ? Cest lune des questions de la classe de 6e2 du collège Sophie Germain de Strasbourg à loccasion de la journee internationale de la fille le 11 octobre.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Sur les reseaux sociaux, chacun y va de sa petite recette du bonheur et de la vie saine. Une recherche de perfection qui vire parfois à l’obsession. Le developpement personnel est-il la garantie de la reussite ? Cette quete d’absolu ne nous prive-t-elle pas de l’essentiel ?

programme.title: Construire des visions
programme.desc: Cap sur des concepts architecturaux novateurs hautement adaptables. Dans cet episode : La Nouvelle-Orleans. L’architecte Jonathan Tates et son equipe conçoivent des habitations pour des veterans traumatises, d’anciens prisonniers ou encore des primo-accedants disposant dun faible capital.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: Quelles sont les causes de la depression, ce mal dont personne n’est à l’abri ? Comment lui faire face et retrouver l’equilibre ? "Twist" donne la parole à des artistes concernes par ce trouble psychique pour briser le silence et aider les autres à se sentir moins seuls.

programme.title: Dans le sud de la Toscane
programme.desc: La Toscane attire des visiteurs du monde entier, qui se pressent au nord, à Florence et à Pise, ou dans la region viticole du Chianti. Le sud de cette region recèle aussi des joyaux plus confidentiels. Son authenticite transparaît dans ses paysages encore sauvages, en meme temps que chez ses habitants vaillants et pleins dune joie de vivre tout italienne.

programme.title: Les delices d’Émilie-Romagne
programme.desc: Un delicieux voyage à la croisee des traditions culinaires du nord de lItalie. Cette etape nous emmène de Parme à Bologne, en passant par Modène. Au menu : des tortellini à la mortadelle et au jambon de parme, du porc agremente d’une sauce aigre-douce aux cerises, et un gâteau confectionne à partir de genoise à la farine de châtaigne et au chocolat.

programme.title: L’archipel d’Hawaï
programme.desc: L’île dHawaï, aussi appelee "Big Island", est la plus etendue de l’archipel du meme nom. Le volcan qu’elle abrite, le Kilauea, est très actif ; autour du cratère, quelques rares promeneurs profitent de paysages grandioses, à l’instar de la New-Yorkaise Jade Chen.

programme.title: L’archipel d’Hawaï
programme.desc: Situees au centre de l’archipel, les îles Maui et Molokai ont des attraits bien distincts. La première est très prisee des surfeurs : Archie Kalepa y savoure les grosses vagues depuis de nombreuses annees. La musique et la danse de l’île sont egalement très reputees. La deuxième île, Molokai, est bien plus calme : avec un seul et unique hôtel, elle a ete très preservee du tourisme.

programme.title: Larchipel dHawaï
programme.desc: La troisième plus grande île de l’archipel, Oahu, abrite Honolulu, la capitale de ce qui est aussi le 50e État americain. Situee sur la côte sud, elle est particulièrement reputee pour son quartier de Waikiki, separe du reste de la ville par un canal, qui compte un port et une plage paradisiaque.

programme.title: Quand lhistoire fait dates
programme.desc: En 212 de notre ère, la loi imperiale dite edit de Caracalla elargit la citoyennete romaine à tous les habitants libres de lEmpire. C’est une loi fondamentale de l’Empire romain tardif, qui pose les principes fondamentaux d’identite et de citoyennete. Que raconte cet evenement sur la Rome du IIIe siècle ? Avec Audrey Bertrand.

programme.title: Le prestige
programme.desc: Londres en 1878. Rupert Angier et Alfred Borden sont deux magiciens surdoues, promis dès leur plus jeune âge à un glorieux avenir. Une competition amicale les oppose dabord lun à lautre, mais lemulation tourne vite à la jalousie, puis à la haine. Devenus de farouches ennemis, les deux rivaux vont sefforcer de se detruire lun lautre en usant des plus noirs secrets de leur art. Cette obsession aura pour leur entourage des consequences dramatiques.

programme.title: Une histoire mondiale de la navigation
programme.desc: Depuis quand les humains sillonnent-ils les mers ? Une retrospective de l’histoire de la navigation, de l’Antiquite jusqu’à la mise à leau des premiers paquebots, illustree par dimpressionnantes archives.

programme.title: Des animaux et des arbres
programme.desc: Traversee dimages spectaculaires, cette immersion dans la foret gaspesienne, au Canada, revèle les liens etonnants quentretiennent les arbres et les animaux.

programme.title: Concert de lOpera de Vienne - Elīna Garanca, Benjamin Bernheim, Jonas Kaufmann
programme.desc: Top depart pour la saison 2025 de lOpera de Vienne ! En plein air, dans le joyau vert du Burggarten, le maestro Bertrand de Billy dirige des voix hors pair (Camilla Nylund, Elina Garanca, Jonas Kaufmann, Benjamin Bernheim et Boris Pinkhasovich) sur des airs de Puccini, Gounod, Bizet ou encore Wagner.

programme.title: Karambolage
programme.desc: Les Français – comme les Allemands - aiment s’asperger d’eau de Cologne. Mais pourquoi l’eau de Cologne s’appelle-t-elle "eau de Cologne" ? - Michel Souris nous propose une petite sortie culturelle au Louvre à la (re)decouverte de la Joconde.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: Camille Claudel, sculpter pour exister
programme.desc: Une exploration sensible de la trajectoire de la sculptrice Camille Claudel (1864-1943), qui accorde une place particulière aux rapports qu’elle entretint avec ses consoeurs.

programme.title: Les noces rebelles
programme.desc: Dans lAmerique des annees 50, Frank et April Wheeler se considèrent comme des etres à part, des gens speciaux, differents des autres. Ils ont toujours voulu fonder leur existence sur des ideaux eleves. Lorsquils emmenagent dans leur nouvelle maison sur Revolutionary Road, ils proclament fièrement leur independance. Jamais ils ne se conformeront à linertie banlieusarde qui les entoure, jamais ils ne se feront pieger par les conventions sociales.

programme.title: Kate Winslet, resolument actrice
programme.desc: Confrontee dès son plus jeune âge au diktat de la minceur, Kate Winslet dessine un parcours à sa façon, en choisissant dincarner des femmes authentiques, à la psyche complexe et au corps realiste, montrant une resolution sans faille dans ses choix dinterpretation.

programme.title: Hotel Metamorphosis - Festival de Salzbourg 2025
programme.desc: Quand les "Metamorphoses" dOvide rencontrent la musique de Vivaldi : conçu et mis en scène par Barrie Kosky, un spectacle effervescent presente au Festival de Salzbourg 2025. Avec Cecilia Bartoli, Lea Desandre, Nadezhda Karyazina et Philippe Jaroussky, ainsi que lactrice Angela Winkler dans le rôle parle dOrphee.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lenses with guests Jo Brand, Josh Widdicombe, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks through a list of L-themed larks - a liblabble, as he calls it. With The Reverend Richard Coles, Sara Pascoe, Bill Bailey and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the quite interesting side of all things lethal, with a deadly and dangerous panel of Bill Bailey, Sandi Toksvig, Jason Manford and Alan Davies. Topics covered include the hazards of laptop batteries and sugar-free sweets.

programme.title: The Weakest Link Celebrity Specials
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts the general knowledge quiz where eight celebrities are put to the test as they compete to win up to £50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In...
programme.desc: Richard and Lena Dunham fast forward through Tenerife, with a visit to a volcano, some stargazing, a sculpture tour, layered coffee, a spot of golf, and a whale hunt.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by coming up with the answers that no-one else can think of.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by coming up with the answers that no-one else can think of.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the quite interesting side of all things lethal, with a deadly and dangerous panel of Bill Bailey, Sandi Toksvig, Jason Manford and Alan Davies. Topics covered include the hazards of laptop batteries and sugar-free sweets.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lovely with guests Josh Widdicombe, Aisling Bea, Tony Hawks and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Ladies and Gents with guests Ross Noble, Kathy Lette, Sue Perkins and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lying with guests Sarah Pascoe, Jack Whitehall, Adam Hills and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lumped Together with guests David Mitchell, Roni Ancona, Jimmy Carr and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a witty and wordy edition of the quiz, centering on the theme of “No L.” With his trademark mix of knowledge and charm, he challenges a star-studded panel featuring the legendary Carrie Fisher, the ever-imaginative Bill Bailey, the quick-fire Jimmy Carr, and the reliably mischievous Alan Davies. Together, they bring sharp humor, clever banter, and plenty of laughs to this uniquely themed episode.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lucky Losers with guests Jeremy Clarkson, Sandi Toksvig, Danny Baker and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the multi-sized world of the little and the large. With Richard Osman, Lucy Porter, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Where the Wild Men Are with Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben Fogle travels to the forests of Chile to meet northern Brit Scott and his young family, and visit their hand-built off-grid cabin in the woods.

programme.title: Where the Wild Men Are with Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben travels to Eastern Europe to meet Brits Jordan, Lewis, and their children, who undertake the renovation of a dilapidated farmhouse in a Bulgarian village. With the countrys population on the decline, Ben is curious about their choice.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Audley End, Essex, where experts value a sword that played an important role in the end of the American War of Independence, a collection of toilet chains and a silver container that once contained a goats gallstone believed to have magical powers. The biggest shock of the day comes when Eric Knowles reveals the worth of a set of three vases decorated with fairies.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return visit to Audley End in Essex sees Fiona Bruce and the team of experts meeting thousands of visitors who are bringing family treasures for appraisal.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team of experts make a return visit to Hanbury Hall near Droitwich in Worcestershire, where it seems that extraordinarily large objects are the talking point of the day.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The celebratory launch of a new luxury resort is cut short when a woman is found electrocuted in her hotel bathtub - with the door locked from the inside. It looks like a simple case of suicide, but with Jack Mooney no longer around to confirm Commissioner Selwyns suspicions, DI Neville Parker is temporarily flown over from Manchester to close the case. However, he soon realises that island life is not for him, so when evidence of suspicious activity turns up, he is dismayed to realise he will have to extend his stay and investigate the case as murder.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A desert island survival course goes wrong when the leader is found dead in the forest of a remote island near Saint Marie. Suspicion soon falls upon the other participants on the course, but they all seem able to provide each other with alibis. Neville and Commissioner Patterson follow a lead that takes them back to the remote island, but a storm is brewing.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Saint Marie welcomes a new DI but the Caribbean island isnt exactly his idea of paradise. The team are left stumped when the owner of a hair salon is killed in front of her family without anyone seeing what happened.

programme.title: Worlds Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Return of the travel series narrated by Bill Nighy, beginning with a trip from the Kyle of Lochalsh, a tiny fishing village on the far west coast of Scotland. The jounrney heads east across the Highlands, then turns south through the whisky country of Speyside to Aberdeen, Scotlands oil capital.

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals

programme.title: Toad And Friends

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Smudge wins Chief’s offer of being Chief for a day and proposes to deface the statue of Toad outside Toad Hall as a futile gesture to rile Toad! However Toad loves the modernistic approach to his statue and resolves to track down the unknown artist.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its a stormy day, and Toad ignores Rattys instructions to tie the sail down. The sail takes off, taking Ratty, Mole, and Hedge with it. Toad has to take to the skies himself in order to save his friends.

programme.title: Toad And Friends

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A block containing Grizzy and the Lemmings ancestors cracks during their fight and frees the ancestors.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover a very particular cocoa tree with chocolate-spread sap! Grizzy decides to siphon off their tree.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Just like every year for Halloween Fred refuses to leave the house. He believes that no mysteries will be solved on that day and that nothing will go as planned.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: On a trip to Japan to visit Velmas friend, the gang comes face to face with the ancient crab monster, Kaniaku, and attempts to solve a 700 year-old mystery. Meanwhile, Daphne accidentally becomes a viral media sensation in Japan!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless halfwit finds a treasure map in a dusty corner of his attic, but the road to riches proves a rocky one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at the supermarket when he spots a cool fire engine ride – but the security guard makes it clear it’s for little kids only. When he finally does get his go, it’s not as good as he thought it would be, especially when a real fire engine has to be called to help Mr Bean!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Beans electricity is cut off when Mrs Wicket sees her electricity bill, but he has a back-up idea - a wind turbine. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean attempts to retrieve his cash card and "accidently" ends up inside a bank vault.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

Armed with several bin bags Mr Bean collects all the rubbish and puts up his own ‘No Littering’ signs - which have absolutely no effect. When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Lamput

Lamput and the Docs have to team up to get the new ghostly resident back to where he belongs!

programme.desc: Bean turns superhero in an attempt to outwit a cunning cat burglar.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidently causes Mrs Wicket to be hospitalised and in need of a wheelchair. The bell doesn’t stop ringing and an exhausted Mr Bean finds himself running up and down the stairs carrying and fetching until he eventually loses patience with his patient.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

Since he cannot afford a new sofa costing £300, Bean decides to have a yard sale. Eventually, he sells a stamp for £300 to a passerby and then buys the sofa. However, Bean soon realises that his TV remote is still inside the old sofa.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a container filled with metal survival food flasks.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a trunk, Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a big chocolate egg with a surprise inside. They are licking their lips.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings open a nightclub with blasting music and a disco ball in an igloo they have built not far from the cabin. The noise prevents Grizzy from sleeping. The bear confiscates the disco ball and propels the Lemmings far into the distance. They land in an ice cave where they discover a console that lights up the stars in the sky and controls the northern lights. The canopy of heaven starts blinking. The Lemmings transform the ice field into an open-air discotheque!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings come up with a ride worthy of a county fair in the living room. Awakened, Grizzy throws their juice extractor out the window and the rodents land in the neighboring science station where they accidentally wake up… a mammoth! A friendship is born between them. The Lemmings drag the mastodon into their game, and he transforms the entire cabin into a Ferris Wheel. Grizzy, who was trying to doze in peace, wakes up in a panic.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest rangers house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels its only natural that the ranger¿s house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bears privilege"except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: While Grizzy fishes, a penguin comes over and sees that the bears bucket is empty. He decides to help him and catches piles of fish. Impressed, the bear brings the penguin back to the cabin, where a friendship rapidly strikes up. This pleasant and friendly new companion quickly arouses the Lemmings curiosity. They lure the penguin away on the sly and replace him with another one whos not nearly as clever. Grizzy will quickly see through the trickery.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Just as Grizzy settles into the couch by the fireside, the Lemmings come charging into the living room on their new mount, the vacuum cleaner. Irritated, the bear throws the mechanical charger into the fireplace, which blows up. Freezing air sweeps into the cabin. Seeking a source of heat, Grizzy decides to move into the science station greenhouse where the temperature is controlled by a drone. But the bear is unaware of what he carries in his luggage: the Lemmings!

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTNs brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the worlds most powerful laser and the worlds smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. An international team of reporters will follow the guidance of Occams Razor - the principle that the simplest explanation is the best one. RAZOR will show that we are already ""living in the future"!

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: In remote jungles, Josh explores one of the 20th centurys biggest heists: the looting of Cambodian statues. He descends into a crumbling pyramid.

programme.title: Expedition X
programme.desc: Horrified locals in Iowa are reporting sightings of a giant winged creature - the same mysterious beast that terrorized the town of Van Meter 100 years ago.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The team head back to Ellwood City to salvage the rectory of St. Agathas Catholic Church. The crew find a triple sink, glass blocks and storm door.

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: The buyers are at Miami International Airport, home to 10,000 lost bags every year. Mark bids on bags of jewellery hoping to strike gold and Billy eyes up a heavy bag.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew buys a haul of rare furniture and what he says is the worst chair hes ever bought, wades through mountains of film and television paraphernalia, then leaves no corner unchecked at a lace factory where he literally goes home with the kitchen sink.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how mobile concert stages are built and mascara is manufactured.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how NASCAR car bodies are manufactured and thermal coffee pots are produced.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Examines how items such as electric vehicle charging stations, grappa, and lunar rover replicas are manufactured.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how slate tiles are produced and hot dog carts are made.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a 2002 Chevy Corvette Z06 that can do zero to sixty in under four seconds. Ant is less than enthused when he realizes the scale of the work needed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike restores a rare 1991 Alfa Romeo 164L. They soon find out that although the car has perfect bodywork, it also has a leaking engine

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard asks two experts to revive a vintage motorised bicycle. Meanwhile, woodworker Robin Johnson tries to restore a Victorian writing table.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Metalworker Ted and gilder Ruth team up to revamp a rusty horse statue. Robin works on a mid-century Danish table, while Julia revives a damaged bar sign.

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: In Halifax, the guys hope to find deep-sea treasure. But only Mark gets his hands on a vintage battleship plaque and his feet into a pair of brass divers slippers.

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Christinas massive warehouse in Providence is home to more than 200 very strange items. Will Billy, Valerie and Mark get too spooked to make a deal?

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: The Prince of Pawn is unleashing a torrent of high-end antiques from a personal collection. Will Mark, Billy or Valerie take home the biggest bling?

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Follow savvy auction specialists as they travel the world looking to snatch up unclaimed and lost personal property, all in an attempt to turn huge profits.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete creates a climbers haven for an arboreal couple that rivals his love of trees- with 17-foot high ceilings and open-frame timber rafters.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.desc: Famed plastic surgeons Dr Terry Dubrow and Dr Paul Nassif do what they can to support clients who have suffered a range of plastic surgery disasters. They also support an out of this world patient who wants to look like an alien, a woman who wants to like a pixie, and a reality star who wants the doctors to make her look "plastic fantastic". These are just some of the people that Terry and Paul come across as they try to remedy plastic surgeries that have gone wrong, but expect to see many more as they work with clients across the United States. programme.title: Botched
programme.desc: Famed plastic surgeons Dr Terry Dubrow and Dr Paul Nassif do what they can to support clients who have suffered a range of plastic surgery disasters. In this third season, they meet people with all kinds of needs, from a woman whose nipples are too high to an ex-Playboy model who wants a second chance at fixing her nose and body. They also support an out of this world patient who wants to look like an alien, a woman who wants to like a pixie, and a reality star who wants the doctors to make her look "plastic fantastic". These are just some of the people that Terry and Paul come across as they try to remedy plastic surgeries that have gone wrong, but expect to see many more as they work with clients across the United States. Some cases are challenging and some are downright outrageous, but with their special brand of skills, the celebrated doctors at the heart of this American reality series work hard to restore both the looks and the self-confidence of their struggling patients.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The architecture in Washington DC was inspired by the ancient world. But is it possible that the designs and philosophies enshrined in the streets of the US capital were influenced by an otherworldly source?

programme.title: The Search For The Tesla Files
programme.desc: Marc, Jason and Travis follow the trail back to New York where they discover traces of a shadow government bent on keeping Nikola Teslas files secret.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: A top-secret Nazi project - "Die Glocke," was believed to be a time travel device that could soar through the sky and eventually reach the speed of light and beyond. Did Die Glocke actually exist, and could it have been based on alien technology?

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Bob and Johns investigation continues in Spain, Morocco and Argentina. The teams look into Hitlers possible escape route while uncovering a plan for a Nazi Fourth Reich.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the theory that Stonehenge may be a prehistoric astronomical observatory. Ancient astronomer priests may have divined the complex movements of the Sun and Moon, recognising patterns that would not be discovered elsewhere.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Shipwreck Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross first takes on the largest wrecks in Scapa Flow: Germany’s sunken WWI fleet. Ross tries to understand why the proud German fleet ended up at the bottom. The trail leads to an experimental British aircraft carrier submarine.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: New York is one of the most man-made spaces on the planet, but everything from the height of its skyscrapers to the position of its harbour is governed by extraordinary forces.

programme.title: The Hunt For Baltic Gold
programme.desc: The series follows amber hunters on their mission to unearth Baltic Gold. They roam the stormy seaside at night and waddle in the mud during the day. They are present everywhere the 40-million-year-old precious jewel can be found.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: American treasure hunter John Casey returns to the Philippines with a new team and new technology, in a continued effort to solve one of World War IIs greatest mysteries. A satellite scan of the mountain reveals massive metal deposits underground.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Greed, genocide and murder - the likes of Julius Caesar, Genghis Khan, Attila the Hun and Cleopatra stopped at nothing to make sure their names went down in history. Which of these tyrants will be named the number one dictator of the ancient world?

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Reveals for the first time the cockpit and control tower audio recordings of pilot and astronaut confrontations and sightings of unidentified flying objects high in our skies.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: Ancient lore talks of a Canadian warrior tribe that once terrorized the Nahanni valley, decapitating their enemies with scythes. The tribe vanished many years ago, but might have resurfaced in the Alaska Triangle. Missing person reports have coincided with eyewitness sightings of frightening ancient soldiers. Our team investigates the mystery.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: In 479 BC, the Spartans beat the Persians to avenge their defeat at Thermopylae. Discover what it was like to fight in one of historys most tactical and disciplined battles.

programme.title: Food Tech
programme.desc: Host Bobby Bognar explores Italian cuisine across the U.S., sourcing ingredients, pasta secrets in NY, vinegars, wines in CA, and dessert wisdom from NJ to Costa Rica.

programme.desc: After months of tireless work and focused research, the massive excavation to recover the fabled Chappell Vault begins.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have claimed to be able to see into the future. These mystics, prophets, and clairvoyants received visions of events that changed the course of history. But what did their prophecies reveal?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: Humans are just scratching the surface when it comes to what we know about our ancestors. Lost cities, ancient texts, mysterious carvings, and unexplained structures provide clues to a long-forgotten time that goes further back in history.

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: A new, subsurface investigation on Skinwalker Ranch leads to a baffling discovery near Homestead Two.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick, Marty, and the Oak Island team go in-depth with Matty Blake on locations where they hope to unearth buried treasure in the Money Pit area.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: There have been countless sightings of bizarre creatures. Based on eyewitness accounts, they can only be described as monsters that cannot be explained by science. Is it possible that there are terrifying monsters lurking in the shadows?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick partners up with Rick Dale to prove to Corey that he struck oil with an old Gulf sign. Later, the Pawn Stars make a bet to see if a Philippine-American War knife will be a big score. Will this wager end in advance or defeat?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chumlee head to Los Angeles to terminate a deal on several iconic set pieces from the movie. Then, Corey rocks out with some Alice in Chains memorabilia. Plus, Rick and Chumlee test out some old steel printing plates.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: What is the odd, worm-like object seen in the sky in a video Tweeted by a Proof viewer? Did an ROV find the remains of a massive skeleton 2700 ft below the surface of the Mediterranean?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A lifelong escape artist, Forrest Tucker, ends up in San Quentin prison; despite his advanced age, he manages to engineer one of the most audacious prison breaks of all time.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: During WWII, the Nazi war machine created specialized camps that were only used for one purpose, killing prisoners. At Sobibor, a group of Jews that were forced to keep the camp operational, engineered a mass escape that saved many of their lives.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: During the Middle Ages, the Vikings were infamous for being a bloodthirsty band of seafaring warriors. Is it possible that they were not the savage brutes we think of today - but rather, a highly advanced civilisation?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Ultimate Evidence
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a closer look at the evidence as he asks whether Earths stone monoliths were built with extra terrestrial help.

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: An advanced radar experiment conducted high above the Mesa and Triangle reveals evidence appearing to support an incredible theory about Skinwalker Ranch.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: As the team moves closer to retrieving what they believe to be the Chappell Vault, a dangerous event occurs in the Money Pit, and the Fellowship must adjust their plans quickly to avoid disaster.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Many mysteries of planet Earth are far from understood. How was Devils Tower formed? Or why do some people get struck by lightning multiple times? While some may write off these as random occurrences, might they instead point to a new understanding?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey snipes an early 1800s prototype rifle made by the man who invented the Baker Rifle, and one of Marlon Brandos most prized possessions shows up.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When an early handheld video game system comes into play, can Corey make a deal before its game over? Plus, a seller brings Rick a tambourine once played by Prince. Will the negotiation have Rick partying like its 1999?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a customer walks into the shop with a signature worthy of presidential praise, can Corey make a new deal? A magician has an enchanting car once owned by Siegfried and Roy. Will Rick and Corey conjure up the right price before it disappears?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Percy Fawcett and the Lost City of Z: One of the most famous explorers in the world becomes obsessed with a lost city deep in the Amazon jungle. (S6, ep 16)

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: In a world without humans, water turns from life-giver to destroyer—flooding cities, collapsing dams, and triggering ancient forces long kept at bay.

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team relaunches their investigation on Skinwalker Ranch, they are surrounded by a shocking phenomenon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a customer walks in with a "Tommy Boy" poster signed by Chris Farley, will it have Corey saying holy schnikes, or does it belong in a van down by the river?

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: As the team moves closer to retrieving what they believe to be the Chappell Vault, a dangerous event occurs in the Money Pit, and the Fellowship must adjust their plans quickly to avoid disaster.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Percy Fawcett and the Lost City of Z: One of the most famous explorers in the world becomes obsessed with a lost city deep in the Amazon jungle. (S6, ep 16)

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: In a world without humans, water turns from life-giver to destroyer—flooding cities, collapsing dams, and triggering ancient forces long kept at bay.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy has to deliver the giant pongberry to the Pongberry Pie Festival, before it goes off and releases a terrible pong in Okido City!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Asked by the girls to play Prince Berry Charming in the new play that Plum is directing for the Baby Berrykins, Huck pushes aside his reluctance and says yes. Bad goes to comically worse as the girls discover he can’t act, can’t dance, can’t sing, suffers from extreme stage fright, and never really wanted to do the play in the first place. After dress rehearsal devolves into a comedy of errors, Strawberry finally gets the sheepish Huck to confess that acting, singing and dancing are just not for him.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry finds a nest with an egg in it he wants to keep it, but Nana explains that it wouldnt be fair.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to stay up all night so he goes to Dino-World where he can play for as long as he wants.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A common tree frog hops into the garden one wet and rainy day. Leo, Katie and Hero take the frog to the forest, where Ranger Rocky directs them to find the frog’s breeding ground.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The Troublesome Trucks are being particularly cheeky and disobedient. When a new brake van called Bradford arrives from The Mainland Thomas is delighted to work with him as Bradford is excellent at keeping The Troublesome Trucks under control. But Bradford is a real stickler for the rules, and Thomas soon tires of his petty regulations, which are always making him late.. Eventually Thomas is so fed up with Bradford that he decides to go off without a brake van, a reckless and dangerous move, which ends up with Thomas hurtling out of control down Gordon’s Hill with no brake van to stop him.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Samson boasts proudly that he has been given a very special job taking stone from the quarry to the docks. But when he learns that Thomas has been given the same job he tries to find another way to prove how important he is. So he decides to take much more trucks than he should insisting that this will save time. But with so many heavy trucks Samson can’t get over Gordon’s Hill. So it takes even longer and when he asks Thomas to help him, he ends up making Thomas late too. The Fat Controller is not happy, but Samson insists that he’s learned his lesson and won’t make the same mistake again…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to pilot a special drone that Mr Guellec bought for his farm, where a Rainbow Magpie is ruining his fruits. The drone’s loudspeaker is supposed to emit a sound that will repel the bird in a harmless way, but things don’t go as planned. Not only does the Rainbow Magpie look unaffected by the drone, but it even mistakes it for a bird and chases after it. Grisu has a hard time shooing the bird away - with Fumè’s intervention making things worse - until he finds out that luring it to the nearby forest is much more effective…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu helps Toramento, who is setting up a sightseeing tour of the Pink Cave of the Valley. But some funny facts happen in the Cave: signs moving apparently by themselves, strange noises… Toramento suspects that a ghost lives there, but Grisu doesn’t believe it. After a little mayhem, the little dragon finds out that the funny facts are caused by a small but sassy bat, who lives in the Cave and is annoyed by artificial light. Eventually, Grisu, helped by Stella and Toramento, creates a light system built with luminescent rocks, that spreads a soft glow that doesn’t annoy the bat.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox is teaching Rosie and Woodsy how to find their way in the forest. The lesson becomes more difficult when Grandpa disappears. In order to find the way back to the burrow, Rosie and Woodsy will have to put into practice what they have learned and, above all, stop quarrelling.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Saffi has won a “Design a Statue” competition and now Bob and the team are turning her design into a water-fountain for the shopping mall. Saffi explains that her elephant statue design was based on her favourite toy, Mr Trunkers, but has since lost him. So when Muck is chosen to deliver the elephant statue, he promises to take extra special care of it for Saffi. But in his excitement, Muck accidentally knocks the elephant into a wall and scrapes off its paint. Muck can’t quite bring himself to own up to Saffi, so decides to tell Bob what has happened first. On his way to tell Bob, Muck overhears Anish telling Saffi how proud he is of her statue. Muck panics and ends up damaging the elephant more.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Skye Sampson asks Bob and Team to create a beach motocross course on Fixham Beach, Bob is so enthused he decides to compete himself. But it’s been a while since he’s ridden his old bike and he wonders if it will even make it round the course. While Bob and Curtis work on the bike, word gets out that there is a mysterious entrant called the Masked Biker. Scoop and Muck become convinced that the Masked Biker is Leo, hiding his identity to take part even though he isn’t old enough to race.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Someone in Busytown Park got rid of Sally and Hildas newly drawn hopscotch board. Huckle and Lowly set about helping the girls find out whos responsible. As it turns out the culprit isnt a who, but a what - the parks new sprinkler system washed the chalk drawing clean off the sidewalk./ Mr. Gronkle’s great great grandfather has hidden a priceless treasure somewhere and it’s up to Huckle and the gang to find it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an Atlantic puffin in the garden while playing with his remote-controlled car. The Junior Rangers decide to take the puffin home to Iceland. There, Leo has a mishap at the edge of a cliff.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: After an Asian palm civet steals Hero’s food, the Junior Rangers set off to bring the civet back to where it belongs. The trip takes them to the rainforest, a durian plantation and a run-in with a wild boar!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his little brother Gaspard are going to take the plane to go visit Grandpa and Grandma. And for the very first time, without their parents! Gaspard is a bit scared but Simon is there to reassure him and the nice stewardess takes wonderful care of them. During the trip they are going to be in for lots of surprises: they get to visit the cockpit, experience take-off, get a great tray of food, have magical views out the window…and even the turbulence is cool! When the plane lands, Grandma and Grandpa are there to greet them and Simon and Gaspard are more than ready for their next trip up in the sky!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole Max thinks his son Karl is too young to go camping with the other kids. Tilda changes Max’s mind and Karl happily joins the trip. He feels insecure until he helps Tilda in an emergency.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ida asks Molly, if she can look after her duckling Alina. But today of all days, Alina wants to learn how to fly and gets herself in some risky situations – and so Molly has to take some risks too.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole mother Gertrud has a cold, so Tilda watches her kids. The children teach Tilda how to dig. Unfortunately, Tilda’s tunnel leads directly to Rupert, who’s upset about the molehills in his garden.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare falls into a muddy Autumn puddle and is delighted when he startles Little Grey Squirrel, who doesn’t recognize him at first. This starts a great new game of ‘Surprise!’ as they dress up in disguises to surprise the others. But they weren’t ready for Little Field Mouse, who works out a clever way of surprising her friends even more.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their Town Crier badges, Wilson and Brewster each have to make an announcement, speaking loudly, clearly and with style. Brewster is too quiet and nobody listens to him. Wilson is loud and clear, but he exaggerates! Having failed their first badge attempt, Wilson and Brewster decide to help each other. Brewster teaches Wilson how to stick to the facts and Wilson gives Brewster pointers on announcing with pizzazz. They both earn their badges on the second try!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On the vibrant shores of an Indonesian island, Kai embarks on a thrilling adventure with his revolutionary Kaizer Drone, equipped with a cutting-edge animal translator capable of converting dolphin squeals into human speech. Later, he stumbles upon a mysterious whale that bore an uncanny resemblance to a fearsome shark. Meanwhile, in a nearby garden, Leo and Katie engage in training sessions with their loyal canine companion, Hero, using a bag of delectable animal treats to hone his communication skills. Amidst Heros baffling barks, Leo receives an urgent call from Kai, who unveils his astonishing discovery. Captivated by the intrigue, Katie and Leo agree to rendezvous with Kai when they learn that the magnificent whale shark has become ensnared in a fishing net. As the Junior Rangers arrive at Kais location, clad in their sleek wetsuits, they confront the sight of the majestic creature helplessly entangled. Contemplating the potential risks of liberating a shark, they find solace in the sudden arrival of Ranger Rocky, who imparts words of caution. Seeking expert advice, the Junior Rangers connect with Ranger Joey, who enlightens them on the harmless nature of the whale shark. After bidding farewell to Ranger Rocky, they summon their courage and attempt to free the captive creature.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was bird gazing in the rainforest, to which then she hears a birdcall from an unknown bird. She finally locates it and sees a unique male Superb Bird of Paradise, in the middle of doing its courting dance. Fascinated, Farah plans to call the Junior Rangers in learning more. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are having a friendly dancing competition. Hero joins them for a moment before Leo receives a call from Farah. Farah shares the bird picture to them and they learned its a Superb Bird of Paradise. They then worried if the bird might be injured so the Junior Rangers agree in meeting with Farah. The Junior Rangers arrives and quietly meet with Farah as they hide behind some bushes. They notice the bird is cleaning an open area. Misunderstood of the situation, the Junior Rangers thought the bird need help of building a nest so they scatter around to find materials to give to the bird. As they try to give the bird the materials they gather, the bird gets upset and clean again. Confused of the situation, they then get greeted by Ranger Rocky.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina finds T’choupi’s baby sister Fanni so cute that she suggests they go out and find other "babies," in the hamlet. Launching a "baby quest," she and T’choupi come across a chick, a baby rabbit, a caterpillar and a little snail! Next, they head to the woods to find more babies. But T’choupi suddenly gapes as he spots the cutest young animal of them all: a baby hedgehog, also known as a "hoglet."

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Luce has brought one of T’choupi’s favorite games: a Seek And Find game based on Nature! Mom comes along and suggests they go for a walk in the forest. The kids love the idea… as long as we can bring the game with! Mom agrees. But on the way, Luce drops the game, losing some of the pieces. She doesn’t say anything to the others, but when the time comes to start playing, the missing pieces make it impossible to continue past a certain point! Oh nooo!! So Mom suggests they play Seek And Find for real, in the forest! The first one to find a chestnut, a hedgehog or a frog…!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Paulie is very proud to bring his remote-controlled car to school! But the toy is not allowed … So when it accidentally runs over the director’s foot, the car is immediately confiscated! The only way in which Paulie will be able to recover the toy is if he behaves well, very well….

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The Treasure Cupboard: Julia wonders why her mum stores the gifts in the closet while Sams mum displays his in the living room. (S1, ep 15)

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam feels a little invaded by the birth of three babies at home. But Julia, who always dreamt of having brothers and sisters, finds the occasion to play doll. How to spend their afternoon together?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: After a benign little fall, Julia obtains a bandage from her mom: an occasion to be pitied in all the Mansion. But Julia needs to be sure no one, even Sam, discover the trickery...

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas’ new Italian friends, Lorenzo and his coach Beppe, do everything together, but one day, Lorenzo decides he’d like to do things by himself for a change. Beppe is hurt when Lorenzo leaves him behind so he can deliver the legendary Opera Star, Bella Canto, to a music festival. Lorenzo meets his match in Bella - she’s a soloist and a diva who wants to do everything by herself, her way! She doesn’t let Lorenzo join in with her singing and demands he take her a different route. Not wanting to let her down, Lorenzo follows her command, but without his trusty Beppe – and his sense of direction – they end up lost! Luckily, Beppe knows that, deep down, his friend needs him, so comes to rescue and the pair are reunited once more.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Its Darcy to the rescue when Monty falls down an old mine shaft while working on the new visitors park.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: On a super hot day, Caillou and Leo competitively play a lava level ofDig n Build. When Daddy tries plugging in a fan, he ends upoverloading the circuits, turning the TV and game off! As Leo andCaillou swelter in the heat, they begin to imagine lava rising in thehouse. They learn to work together to help save Gilbert from the lavaand get their game (and the AC) back on!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Its midday and Busytown citizens are dozing off all over town. Huckle, Sally and Lowly try to find out why. Noticing the number of sleeping people holding melted ice cream cones is an important clue. Ultimately, the kids discover that the ice cream truck isnt playing the usual perky tune to announce its arrival - its playing a lullaby./Someone has taken Huckle’s car and left their car in its place!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey has designed a paper airplane, he boasts how this will be the fastest paper airplane ever. But when he throws it, the plane immediately falls to the ground. programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Franklin emulates Mr. Heron and plays “post-turtle” for all his friends, he accidentally misplaces (and doesn’t deliver) a special drawing that Beaver made for Goose. It’s only when he accepts his responsibility in the mess-up, that he feels better about it. /Franklin and his friends make a get-well card for Snail but when Franklin carelessly leaves it on his window ledge, it falls into the road and gets caught up in the wind. Enlisting the help of all his friends to chase the card through a blustery Woodland day, Franklin tries to avoid telling them how it got lost in the first place. But it ends up feeling better to tell the truth.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As Woodsy is going to sleep over at Loudo’s, there is a spare place in the burrow. Rosie wants to invite Biva but Scoutbadger wants to invite Martis. programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky dreams of going to the shooting stars night. But there will be a lot of people and Sketcky wants to get the best spot. Doodleboo knows exactly what he would need to arrive first tonight...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Bubble would like to see a new decoration in the jar and Doodleboo knows perfectly how to embellish it!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave

Using the ladder from Ruff-Ruff’s Rollypod Fire Truck they get Larry safely down; but can the fire-fighter helpers keep him from getting into more trouble and make sure Larry gets safely home!?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave

Bobby the Monkey teaches them his words for ‘follow me’, ‘coconut’, ‘food’ and ‘goodbye’, and at the end of a fun day together they discover ‘Bibble Bink’ means ‘new friend’. They’ve been on A New Friend Adventure all along!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Kipper

The unravelled wool from Pig’s sweater leads them back home.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Jake has lost something in the park – it’s a surprise so he can’t tell Kipper and Tiger what it is. They find a treasure map signed by Bluebeard the pirate and follow the clues. programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

So, he Nina and Benedicte secretly head off to pick some pretty flowers. But they’re going to have to turn it around fast: they only have one day to get the job done!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia lost her lucky seashell, brought back from her island. Sam helps her find it. The investigation leads them to the home of Mrs. Dreamer, the Mansions clairvoyant mouse. But can she really help?

programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.desc: Rupert finds out that Molly has a beautiful singing voice and asks her if she can sing a song for Tildas birthday. Molly absolutely wants to do this but can she overcome her stage fright?

They have to find the keys or therwise everyone will have to sleep on the beach tonight - which by the way, sound good to the Triplets. Maybe raking the beach could be useful? programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are watching a movie on television, when Poet starts to ask Mommy "How do you make a movie ?", she answers him that you need actors band a director to lead them and make the movie. programme.title: Chuggington

programme.title: Charley Goes To School

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
